ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This was my first foray into human rights and I think the course did a really good job of setting the stage of the field and the successes and shortcomings
I learned how to access the methods and theories of political science papers as well as critically analyze different assumptions about human rights.
I learned a lot in this class. My main take-home point was that human rights is not always as easy as we would like it to be.
I liked the second part of the course that focused more on different tools to promote human rights. I think it helps me to think about advocacy tools in a comparative way.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really enjoyed the discussion-based nature of the course, but I would have liked some other form of activities

I think the class taught me so much about human rights research and the different mechanics of human right actors, governments, and other international actors. However, I wish we could have zoomed in a few particular human rights cases.

I have a hard time figuring out if I'm doing good or bad in the class, therefore it would be helpful if the assignments were graded or commented, so I would have an idea. Besides, I would have liked if we read a more policy papers, since this was what we should write for the finals.

The type of final paper was a good idea and I liked the small class size. I wish we had more case studies to think about the application of certain tools instead of spending a lot of time in comparing different research methods for human rights in the beginning of class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would recommend this course to anyone looking for an introduction to human rights

I would take this class if you are interested in taking a deep dive into human rights since the class is focused on not only beliefs in human rights but technical discussions on its tools and methods.
I think the professor should mention it is a political science course
Yes, I would. I found it very interesting and feel that I learned a lot from it.
Yes, depends on the student's needs and interests.
